Description: A chisel of rectangular section: with a slightly convex cutting edge. The edge has been sharpened by hammering and grinding from one side of the tool, the other side being flat. On being cleaned, a distinct mark appeared on the surface of the metal, showing that the tool had been set into a wooden handle to a point 2.5cm from the butt.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tomb of Djer, tomb O.31 subsidiary burial
Curator's comments: Bibliography: W. M. F. Petrie, 'Royal Tombs of the Earliest Dynasties' II, 24, pl.VI, 26. Compare the chisels with wooden handles from tomb 3471 at Saqqara; W. B. Emery, 'Great tombs of the First Dynasty; excavations at Sakkara' I' (Cairo, 1949), 42, fig. 22 and pl.9B.
